column32:
This is a big adjustment for many people. Your first few days of WFH may leave you irritated, uncomfortable, unmotivated, or just plain exhausted. Adding security tips to the list may just add to your fatigue right now. We understand. Take it a day at a time, a step at a time.
When working from home, find a comfortable working area where you can assume a healthy posture, minimize the distraction from others, and where your presence has the least impact on how others have to behave. Take breaks to stretch your legs, and give your eyes a rest. And if you enjoy WFH, now is the time to prove to your employer that it’s a viable option in the long run.

Stay safe, everyone! Now more than ever.

column6:
Guidelines have been provided independently of Covid-19 since work from home was possible before spring 2020.

- Connect to the corporate network via VPN - if possible - to use the Internet for web browsing to take advantage of the company's security infrastructure

- Protect the information displayed on the screen of your device from their exposure to third parties ("shoulder surfing")

- Disconnect connections such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth when not in use.

- Laptops need to be hibernated - and not sleep - when closed to be transferred, so that full disk encryption authentication is enabled.

column32:
People tend to adjust to any difficult situation. 
If coherent / sustainable work from home decision will be taken, we would need to change our perspective on life and world. Maybe consider buying a home out of the crowded city (with a dedicated office space) instead o sating in a small space in the city to reach office in less than one hour :)
I hope this will change our attitude towards what time means.  (3 hours on the road from home to work and back) is not personal / free / healthy time

Question #3 and #4 are problematic. I use company devices and private devices as well, but it's not possible to account for this constellation 
Question #8 also doesn't take into account that you can have a mixed infrastructure (as we have) consisting of Google Cloud Services and local network shares and web services. So I have to use a VPN and a Cloud provider, dependent on the task I have to achieve.
